putincolor: ab := 1;

item.title: Faster way to code findColor?
item.dc:creator: @popcorn89 popcorn89
item.description:
@popcorn89 wrote:

Why don’t you just use GetColor(x,y) and check the return value against each of the colors you’re searching for.

Read full topic

hmm… maybe use getcolor… just at one point, first it looks for the red of a fire rune, just one pixel… if not found then use getcolor for a water rune,with getcolor its prob faster(its only looking at one point, if more then one rune has the its color which is not gray on the same place you can do these runes with the same getcolor, it should be faster… i suppose(i’m not that good scripter after all) soz i cant tell you exactly how to do it, i might try it but wont be doing to tommorow nor tonight ow and could i have your script:)

item.title: Faster way to code findColor?
item.dc:creator: @bobert5696 bobert5696
item.description:
@bobert5696 wrote:

maybe this will explain it better, i cant believe there is no other way to do it, im making a solver for the al morrisons casket thing, i’ve done the math, and i’ve calculated (some luck required) making over a mill an hour with this script on a lvl 3 so what im doing, is searching all 81 spots in it (its sudoku, but with runes if you don’t know) to find out what rune it is, or if its blank, then its gonna go to a sudoku solver online, imput the numbers in it, get the output, and solve the script, i know how to do everything, im just wondering if there is a simpler way, cause i’ll end up having to do findcolors for all the runes, and find bitmaps for all the numbers on a solver (unless someone else knows an easier way) thanks for help in advance

Read full topic

item.title: Faster way to code findColor?
item.dc:creator: @bobert5696 bobert5696
item.description:
@bobert5696 wrote:

is there an easier way to do this than what im doing? heres a snippet of my code:

//a,b
if (findcolor(x,y,1804768,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  1
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1385384,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  2
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14803428,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  3
else
if (findcolor(x,y,11016981,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  4
else
if (findcolor(x,y,936558,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  5
else
if (findcolor(x,y,13705240,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  6
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1184277,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  7
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1812704,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  8
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14689051,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  9
else
if (findcolor(x,y,498170,118,44,147,76))or
 (findcolor(x,y,114921,118,44,147,76))then
ab :=  11;


//a,c
if (findcolor(x,y,1804768,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  1
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1385384,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  2
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14803428,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  3
else
if (findcolor(x,y,11016981,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  4
else
if (findcolor(x,y,936558,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  5
else
if (findcolor(x,y,13705240,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  6
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1184277,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  7
else
if (findcolor(x,y,1812704,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  8
else
if (findcolor(x,y,14689051,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  9
else
if (findcolor(x,y,498170,117,81,149,112))or
 (findcolor(x,y,114921,117,81,149,112))then
ac :=  11;

i need to do that for 81 sqaures, all checking for the same color, but in different coords, is there an easier way to code this (im at 1800 lines of code, and not even half way done with only the color finding part of the script, plus it will take forever to add all the coords to all of them, i stoped adding coords after 3 of them, i was gonnago back and add them)

Read full topic
